project_description: OBOP is an HDFC Bank initiative to unify and centralize the management and delivery of customer offers across all digital assets by leveraging a single set of APIs and a centralized intelligence engine. The project aims to provide a consistent, personalized, and seamless customer experience by ensuring that each customer sees the same next best offers (NBOs) across all HDFC Bank digital touchpoints.
objectives: Provide a unified and consistent customer experience across all HDFC Bank digital touchpoints.
Establish a single source of truth for offer selection and delivery to each customer.
Increase customer engagement with offers by eliminating discrepancies across portals.
Enable centralized management, onboarding, and approval of offers.
Support both real-time API-based and batch-based NBO delivery to mitigate system stability risks.
scope: Onboarding and display of Smartbuy offers, Alliance offers (including Easy EMI), and Consumer Durable Loans offers.
Hashed mobile number-based customer identification and intelligence.
Monthly dump of top 40 merchant recommendations per customer from CIU to Crayon Data.
Rule-engine based offer selection and real-time interaction-based personalization.
Integration of Choice API with Smartbuy portal.
Offer Management Platform with maker-checker personas and approval/rejection flows.
Support for store locations via zip codes.
Batch file generation for NBO delivery to non-API integrated assets (netbanking app, website).
Banking product/portfolio offers (e.g., personal loan, home loan).
Integration with third-party tools or software.
Real-time personalization and interaction tracking on non-Smartbuy assets.
Performance tracking on non-API integrated assets.
Location-based offers for non-API integrated assets.
stakeholders: Offer Onboarding Teams (Smartbuy, Alliance, Payzapp, Consumer Durables Loan)
Asset Owning Teams (Netbanking app, HDFC website, etc.)
Crayon Data (Choice API and backend intelligence)
key_features: Centralized offer management and onboarding via Offer Management Portal (OMP).
Unified customer identification using hashed mobile number.
Monthly ingestion of top 40 merchant recommendations per customer.
Rule-engine based offer selection and dynamic personalization.
Choice API powering recommendations across digital assets.
Batch-based NBO delivery for non-API integrated assets.
Personalized and generic offer lists (Curated offers, Top Trending, Top offers in city, Easy EMI).
Marketing veto capability for prioritized merchant display.
SSO integration for seamless user redirection between assets.
Interaction tracking (like/dislike, views, bookmarks) on Smartbuy.
technical_requirements: Single tenant architecture for HDFC Bank data.
CIU to Crayon Data file transfer via SFTP (parquet format, up to 50GB).
Hashed mobile number as unique customer identifier.
Choice API integration with Smartbuy portal (real-time) and batch file generation for other assets.
API whitelisting between Crayon Data and R360.
Stage and Production environments for integration and performance testing.
Encrypted SFTP transfer with checksum validation.
Support for 10 million API calls/month for MVP1, scalable to 40 million/month.
Offer data ingestion in OMP format.
Compliance with agreed-upon card type values and merchant categories.
Front end integration with SSO for seamless user experience.
timeline_estimate: Each sprint delivers ~2 features/improvements every 2 weeks. Post CIU file validation, data pipeline publishing takes 5 working days (plus 5 more for rule or structure changes). Full MVP1 timeline not explicitly stated.
risks: Potential system instability or crashes due to API integrations (mitigated by batch-based approach for some assets).
Inconsistent or incomplete CIU data leading to incorrect customer segmentation (ETB/NTB).
Delays in offer data or CIU file sharing from HDFC Bank.
Inability to track user interactions or performance on non-API integrated assets.
Dependency on SFTP size and access managed by HDFC Bank.
Potential compliance or network whitelisting delays.
Changes in hashed mobile number mapping may result in loss of user history.
assumptions: HDFC Bank will create and maintain a unified customer identifier (hashed mobile number) and share it with Crayon Data.
Same rule engine applies across all use cases.
Expected API traffic is 10 million/month for MVP1, scalable to 40 million/month.
For MVP1, HDFC Bank will share Alliance and Smartbuy offers in OMP template; from MVP2, all offers will be onboarded via OMP.
All customers are assumed to have debit cards; credit card data comes from CIU file.
SFTP infrastructure is adequately provisioned and managed by HDFC Bank.
CIU will ensure data consistency and completeness in monthly files.
No real-time personalization or interaction tracking on non-Smartbuy assets.
Front end rendering and SSO on non-Smartbuy assets are HDFC Bank's responsibility.
